page.title: 11Young people in Bookham
page.content:
For the young, Bookham has the advantage of easy rail links to London and open countryside a few minutes' walk from the High Street. Schools in the area have high standards with better than average exam results providing opportunities for higher education which many take up.
Being a dormitory area with no real industry of its own, the villages provide little employment for the young and inexperienced.
Roteract and Pose are young people's groups and some of the churches have youth groups. There appears to be a divide between the older inhabitants and the young, with little opportunity for them to mix socially. Students on holiday and the young unemployed find little to do in Bookham.
